bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 15, 1941

div1.p: Hench sends Hutchison a reprint of his article in "Hygeia" and an article about the Cornwell painting. He has requested that the Wyeth Company send Hutchison a large reproduction of the painting for display in Lazear Hall.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 15, 1941
div1.p:
I am sending herewith a reprint from the current
Hygeia which will interest you, also an article about the
painting. There is an interesting story in connection with
it which I shall tell you when you come. I have asked the
Wyeth Co. to send you a large reproduction of the painting,
thinking it should go in Lazear Hall somewhere.

How soon are you coming out here? Any time would
be fine. My but I'd love to see you! I mean it. Horace
Davis is doing fine and will be dismissed home this weekend.
He appreciated so much your letter and the wire from the
Board.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
